_description: IAB Transparency & Consent Framework v2.2 purpose taxonomy. Extracted from the IAB Global Vendor List (GVL) specification. Used to understand and classify privacy purposes declared by consent management platforms.

1.name: Store and/or access information on a device
1.description: Cookies, device or similar online identifiers together with other information can be stored or read on your device to recognise it each time it connects to an app or website.
1.notes: Foundational purpose required by almost all vendors. Required for setting any cookie or accessing device storage.

2.name: Use limited data to select advertising
2.description: Advertising can be shown based on limited data such as the content being viewed, the app being used, approximate location, or device type.
2.notes: Contextual advertising. Less intrusive than profiling-based ads.

3.name: Create profiles for personalised advertising
3.description: A profile can be built about you and your interests to show you personalised advertising that is relevant to you.
3.notes: Builds user profiles over time. Core concern for GDPR privacy advocates.

4.name: Use profiles to select personalised advertising
4.description: Personalised advertising can be shown to you based on a profile about you.
4.notes: Uses profiles built in Purpose 3. Often paired together.

5.name: Create profiles to personalise content
5.description: A profile can be built about you and your interests to show you personalised content that is relevant to you.
5.notes: Content personalisation rather than ad personalisation. Still involves profiling.

6.name: Use profiles to select personalised content
6.description: Personalised content can be shown to you based on a profile about you.

7.name: Measure advertising performance
7.description: The performance and effectiveness of ads that you see or interact with can be measured.
7.notes: Ad measurement analytics. Many vendors claim legitimate interest for this.

8.name: Measure content performance
8.description: The performance and effectiveness of content that you see or interact with can be measured.
8.notes: Content analytics. Lower privacy risk than ad tracking.

9.name: Understand audiences through statistics or combinations of data from different sources
9.description: Reports can be generated based on the combination of data sets regarding your interaction and those of other users.

10.name: Develop and improve services
10.description: Your data can be used to improve existing systems and software, and to develop new products.
10.notes: Product development. Broad purpose that can cover many activities.

11.name: Use limited data to select content
11.description: Content can be shown to you based on limited data such as the website or app you are using, your non-precise location, your device type, or which content you are interacting with.
11.notes: Added in TCF v2.2. Basic content selection without profiling.

1.name: Ensure security, prevent and detect fraud, and fix errors
1.description: Your data can be used to monitor for and prevent unusual and possibly fraudulent activity, and ensure systems and processes work properly and securely.
1.notes: Security purpose. Users cannot object to this. Always allowed.

2.name: Deliver and present advertising and content
2.description: Certain information like an IP address or device capabilities is used to ensure the technical compatibility of the content or advertising and to facilitate the transmission of content.
2.notes: Basic ad delivery. Users cannot object. Required for technical delivery.

3.name: Save and communicate privacy choices
3.description: The choices you make regarding the purposes and entities listed in this notice are saved and made available.
3.notes: Added in TCF v2.2. Stores and communicates user consent preferences.

1.name: Match and combine data from other data sources
1.description: Data from one data source may be combined with data from other data sources and matched to your online profile.
1.notes: Cross-source data matching. Significant privacy concern.

2.name: Link different devices
2.description: It can be determined that two or more devices belong to the same user or household.

3.name: Receive and use automatically-sent device characteristics for identification
3.description: Your device might be distinguished from other devices based on information it automatically sends when accessing the internet.
3.notes: Device fingerprinting. Can be used without cookies.

1.name: Use precise geolocation data
1.description: With your acceptance, your precise location can be used for purposes such as targeted advertising.
1.notes: GPS-level location tracking. Requires explicit consent. Very high privacy risk.

2.name: Actively scan device characteristics for identification
2.description: With your acceptance, certain characteristics specific to your device can be requested and used to distinguish it from other devices.
2.notes: Active device fingerprinting. More intrusive than passive fingerprinting. Requires consent.
